docs.lead_paragraph: Who needs a motion to proceed?

headline.main: Debate Begins Already on Emerging Health Care Bills

docs.abstract: Democratic Congressional leaders have yet to unveil a complete draft of the health care legislation, or formally take up the bill in either chamber. But in a sense floor debate is already underway.
docs.snippet: Democratic Congressional leaders have yet to unveil a complete draft of the health care legislation, or formally take up the bill in either chamber. But in a sense floor debate is already underway.

docs.lead_paragraph: First, parents were bankrolling their 20-something children, paying tuition bills for private colleges, globe-trotting adventures and rent after college. Then the 30-something offspring needed down payments, money for their own children's summer camp, cars and school tuition. What next? If their net worth hasn't been devastated by the recession, will these parents who reach their 70s and 80s be subsidizing their children's retirement?
docs.abstract: More and more people, even in middle age, can't make ends meet without aid from their parents.
docs.snippet: More and more people, even in middle age, can't make ends meet without aid from their parents.

docs.lead_paragraph: In recent weeks, polls kept showing solid support for a public insurance option, seeming to breathe new life into its viability as a provision of the health care legislation under way in Congress. In fact, advocates of a public option, from left-leaning groups to pundits to lawmakers, seized on each new number and trumpeted the news across the 24/7 news spectrum of Twitter, TV ads, blogs and headlines.
docs.abstract: Polls in the last few weeks gave renewed life to the public insurance option, but support for it changes depending on how the questions are posed.
docs.snippet: Polls in the last few weeks gave renewed life to the public insurance option, but support for it changes depending on how the questions are posed.

docs.lead_paragraph: There's nothing like marrying, moving and getting laid off for starting a new financial life.

headline.main: Bucks Bio: How Harder Times Made Me Smarter

docs.abstract: The lead blogger for Bucks recounts her own experience in making ends meet.
docs.snippet: The lead blogger for Bucks recounts her own experience in making ends meet.

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON -- House Democratic leaders have scheduled a rally for Thursday where they plan to unveil legislation to overhaul the health care system, which they hope to take to the House floor next week.

headline.main: House to Roll Out Its Health Care Bill Thursday

docs.abstract: House Democratic leaders plan to introduce their health care legislation on Thursday, and hope to take it to the House floor next week.
docs.snippet: House Democratic leaders plan to introduce their health care legislation on Thursday, and hope to take it to the House floor next week.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama is a day closer to wrapping up deliberations over how to proceed with the war in Afghanistan, now in its ninth year, and is expected to announce his decision "soon," according to Robert Gibbs, the White House press secretary. In the afternoon, Mr. Obama will meet with Vice President Joseph R, Biden Jr. and Robert M. Gates, the Defense secretary, in the Oval Office.
docs.abstract: President Obama is a day closer to wrapping up deliberations over how to proceed with the war in Afghanistan, and is expected to announce his decision "soon."
docs.snippet: President Obama is a day closer to wrapping up deliberations over how to proceed with the war in Afghanistan, and is expected to announce his decision "soon."

docs.lead_paragraph: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago.

headline.main: Home Sick: Another Case Where Work Incentives Matter

docs.abstract: Economic research has shown that workers in the Netherlands, Sweden and Norway often stay home sick. Incentives, and not the flu, seem to be the explanation, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: Economic research has shown that workers in the Netherlands, Sweden and Norway often stay home sick. Incentives, and not the flu, seem to be the explanation, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: John Stossel, the newest star of the Fox Business Network, is also starring this week at a series of events orchestrated by opponents of a Democratic health care overhaul.

docs.lead_paragraph: The president has proposed sending a $250 check to every Social Security recipient, but some economists recoil.

docs.lead_paragraph: As part of a legal settlement, a consortium will set up a system to help determine reimbursements for patients using out-of-network doctors.
